column3: Thanks,\nThe idea was to switch to Ubuntu 18.04 for building to avoid having to do this, as that ships with a newer NSIS package, but if that turns out not to be feasible before the next release this will be helpful!

>  if that turns out not to be feasible before the next release this will be helpful!\n\nCurrently our Windows gitian cross builds are broken, so we'd *have* to switch to bionic. (Or revert the qt depends bump)

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->Note to reviewers: This pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #13623 (Migrate gitian-build.sh to python by ken2812221)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
This has been fixed in nsis 2.50, and nsis in ubuntu bionic is version 2.51.
> This has been fixed in nsis 2.50, and nsis in ubuntu bionic is version 2.51.\n\nYeah, bionic could be even better.
Holding out on reviewing this until after #13171 is merged or closed.
